locale.message: DOI
This plugin enables the assignment of the Digital Object Identifiers to publication formats in OMP.
DOI Plugin Settings
Please configure the DOI plug-in to be able to manage and use DOIs in OMP:
DOI Plugin Settings Updated
Publication Format Content
Please choose the objects DOIs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Digital Object Identifiers (DOI) assigned:
DOI Prefix
The DOI Prefix is assigned by registration agencies (e.g. CrossRef) and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234):
The DOI prefix is mandatory and must be in the form 10.xxxx.
DOI Suffix
A DOI Suffix choice is required.
A DOI suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same DOI prefix assigned:
Use the pattern entered below to generate DOI suffixes. Use %p for press initials, %m for the monograph id, and %f for the publication format unique id.
for publication formats
For example, press%ppub%f could create a DOI such as 10.1234/pressESPpub100
Use default patterns.
%p.%m.%f for publication formats, %p.%m for monographs,%p.%i for files.
Use the "Custom Identifier" for published items as the DOI suffix (must be enabled in Step 4). This is the same identifier that will be used for public URLs.

Enter an individual DOI suffix for each published item independent and different from the "Custom Identifier" mentioned in the previous option. You'll find an additional DOI input field on each item's meta-data page.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for publication formats.
Reassign DOIs

If you change your DOI configuration, DOIs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the DOI configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing DOIs so that the new settings will take effect with existing publication formats.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing DOIs?
